body_html:
That's correct, there is no backoff, it simply retries 3 times, so that there is at most 4 attempts including the original one.

The underlying layers do not attempt any retries.

The reason for the lack of a backoff was that the actual Google Cloud Storage errors don't require it -- very infrequently GCS can return an internal error for a read or write operation and an immediate retry typically succeeds.

That said, I don't mind having a backoff if it's recommended.
